values:
Nursery in Anaheim getting close to almost done.  Calgary will take a little longer.  So busy lately, barely had any time to update at all.  Boys are wonderful.  Sirpa is ready to stop being kicked constantly.  
The little angel is due in five weeks.  Alex is nervous, but I know he will be a perfect father.  I just have to convince him of that before the baby comes.

Game Seven tomorrow.  
Alex is here with me for now, visiting.  The boys are thrilled to have him, and his little one is kicking him a lot.  Sirpa wants to go to Colorado when it's time.  We should talk about it more, I think.  After playoffs.  

And it was still a goal last night.

I still believe what I said.  But I am sorry I hurt Alex.  

I'm watching NJD@PHI.  Only because there is nothing else on TV to watch.  

Sirpa is in her 20th week now.  We're halfway there.  We'll get everything ready this summer.  Probably in Colorado.  Would be a little easier.  We'll go to Colorado after playoffs and start to get things finished.  

Paul, it was good to see you last week.  The kids enjoyed it too.

It's very early.  But I am very late to update.  I remembered when I saw a note on my computer.  Yes, I know my teeth look bad.  I will fix them when I get back to Anaheim.  The boys think it's funny.  Alex worries.  

http://www.nhl.com/olympics/2006/fin_rus_side022406.html

http://www.nhl.com/olympics/2006/oly_notes022406.html

Quality reading.  If you are a Finn fan.

I realized it has been a few weeks since I updated.

I am at 25 goals now.

Goal 23 was point 999
Goal 24 (same game) was point 1,000.  
We beat L.A. in OT.

Goal 25 tonight was not enough.  We lost, but we still played well.  We didn't give up.  

Alex was there for my 1,000 points.  We had a very nice celebration.  He's trying to catch me with goals.  I guess I'll have to keep scoring or he'll win.  ;)

I gave him my jersey.  I think he likes it.

It is late, but I just remembered that I did not update. And I know it is late right now, but I am not tired, so there. Alex Tanguay and Marek Svatos scored shootout goals to help the Colorado Avalanche maintain their dominance over the Columbus Blue Jackets with a 3-2 victory on Saturday. Tanguay and Svatos also accounted for both Colorado goals in regulation as the Avalanche won their fourth straight. Colorado finally broke through when Tanguay flipped a rebound past Leclaire with Jody Shelley off for slashing. It was Tanguay's 17th goal of the year. I miss my shootout chance in Dallas, and Alex makes his in Colorado. Congratulations, armas. Both goals were beautiful, I'm proud of you. You're catching up to me on goals too.
We will not talk about last night.

Playing has been tough lately.  And busy.  Will not have much time to see Alex until Christmas.  I need to talk to him, and the boys, and Sirpa.  Find out if they want a West Coast Christmas or a Wintery Christmas.  I have some gift ideas, but nothing very definite yet.  Bad Teemu.

The car I bought was not for me.  It was for Alex.  For his birthday.  Because he cannot drive a truck all the time.  He needs a good car.  One that's as gorgeous and quick as he is.  

Happy Birthday, armas.  Lempia Te.
I'm getting a new car. What do you think? Picture

Update from Pepsi Center.
EDITED

1 / 3:00 / COL / A. TANGUAY (4) / J. SAKIC (8) / K. SKRASTINS (4) / 9 44 35 22 14 12 / 18 1 23 19 5 3 / EV


3 / 12:42 / COL / A. TANGUAY (5) / J. LILES (11) / D. AEBISCHER (1) / 7 35 24 22 11 / 18 1 26 23 19 4 / PP

Note to self:  Find FSNW people and glare evilly for telling about surgery on air.  Made Alex all worried for no reason.  My poor enkeli.  He was so tired and came all the way to see me because of them.  Bastards.
....Alex Tanguay added a power-play goal with 1:45 left First goal of the season. Congratulations, armas. Lempia te.

Three points in three games.  Two goals and one assist.  One point per game.  I think it is not a bad way to be starting the season.  I only have one penalty so far too.

But I would like everyone to know that I am keeping track of who keeps hitting my Alex.  I don't mind having more penalties if they are against those people.

First game of the season for me, and I score Anaheim's first goal.  I'm starting to feel more useful now. 
Sergei, it's good you weren't too hurt with that high stick.
Rob and Scott, congratulations on your goals.  Joffrey, congratulations on both of yours also.  

I need to finish watching my husband's game now.

Who scored?  My mielitietty, my sweetheart.  And shorthanded too.  I wish that I could have seen him beat the Red Wings.  I will have other chances, I'm sure.  I have Altitude so I can watch all of his games, and tape the ones I cannot watch when they air.  Like I would ever miss a game of his if there was a way I could help it.  

Alex, I am proud of you.  I love you.

So, back in Anaheim.  I still have my house and my cars here.  Is funny.  Martin was here before and I let him stay in the house since I didn't need it.  Now he is in Dallas, and I'm back in my old home.  With my old team. But things are very different now.  It's going to be interesting, and fun, I'm sure.

This is not a good time for me again.  
And I wrecked my BMW.  Oh well.
I am with Alex in Sweden and I will be there until Alex is ready to go home.  He wants to be there for Peter, and I will be there for Alex.  If anyone needs me, that is where I am.

I am not sure what to say.  I have not talked to anyone in so long.  I miss everyone, very much.  Friends... call me.  I'm not busy, and would love to hear from everyone.  Especially you, Martin.  Call me, yes?
I have been busy lately, forgot to update.  I'm very sorry and promise to update more often.  Promise.

Have not had much time to update since I have been busy.  To friends I have ignored... I am sorry.
Alex was hurt in Switzerland.  I was there.  I have been busy taking care of him.  He says I baby him, I say I care for him.  Just a little argument, loving one, not angry one.  Kids are good.  I saw them when we came back to North America for Alex to be taken more care of.  Boys are being good kids, good students.  For Christmas, we are going to Finland.  Alex too, if he is not too busy with his own family.
Alex has signed with Switzerland.  With David.  I think I will just follow him.  Not to play, but to be with him while he plays.  Until I decide what I want to do.  Maybe nothing.

First game in Round Robin.  4-0 against Czech Republic.  Martin threatened to throw pies in my face.  Evil Czech.  Hmph.  I played a good game then.  Was a lot of fun.

Next game was yesterday.  Was also lots of fun.  3-0 against Germany.  I assisted on first goal, Kimmo's.  Then I got my own goal, powerplay.  Also got a penalty.  But even that was worth it.  It has been so much fun playing and spending time with Alex. 

Saturday is against Sweden.  Will be very interesting.   I have to go now.  Alex is more interesting than this journal.

Stayed in Finland for a while with Alex, Sirpa, and the boys.  Went to Czech Republic after that to spend time with Martin and Patrick.  Has been good just relaxing.  I start training in two days.  Looking forward to seeing all my friends again.  Teppo said he would call as soon as he lands.  Will be wonderful to spend time with him after so long of not seeing each other very much.

Who is your LJ soulmate?
LJ Username
Your soulmate : alex_tanguay
This Quiz by mayfair - Taken 5810 Times.
New - Kwiz.Biz Astrology
Lempia te, armas.

This is to my short-term teammate.  <lj user="clutch_brad"> is 27 today.  So <font size=5> Happy Birthday, Brad </font> and hope whatever had upset you around the time of your last post is better now.  And if you want to get away, there is room in Finland here for you and I am sure Alex would not mind seeing you.  Is of course, your decision, but the invitation is open all summer.

I have been slack in updating.  Just so busy with everything, have not had much time.  Martin is at my home in Anaheim, joyriding in my cars and destroying my beautiful home.  Kidding, of course.  Except for joyriding.  I know he is.  But is fine.  I offered the home to Martin to stay in while he is in Anaheim.  He needs a place of his own instead of hotels or staying with teammates constantly.  I am happy to let my house go to good use and I know he will take good care of it.  If he wants to wash my cars while he's there... well, the car washing things are in the large cabinet behind the Z3.  

For other news... Alex and I are just spending time in Finland, having time alone until the boys are out of school.  That is soon though, and then Sirpa will bring them over and they will start their summer with us.  I love Alex so much for being so caring with my boys.  Not everyone would take on extra baggage of a wife and three children, but they adore Alex because Alex is... Alex is just Alex.  And how can you not adore Alex?  

We will not mention what comes up in September that I was chosen for but Alex was not.  Nor will we mention how someone is only the 'Mediocre One' (I learned new word) and not very great at all of his decision making.  

Final note. A congratulations to Danny and David and a wish of many happy years together.

More ice time today.  I think I did much much better than I have in a long time.  I threw the puck in front enough for Joey to throw it home.  Why is it only Joey is solving Nabby right now?  He's amazing, yes, but David was right.  We cannot expect him to do everything.  Congratulations on tying the record for overtime goals, Joe.

Remember that icon I made? I don't think I want to use it right now. Does anyone know how much it hurts to be in a press box in your old arena, in a place you used to call home, watching your former team kill your current team? I am not bitter, but it hurts. I try, guys. I try so hard. But I just cannot do it. They say maybe I'm back for game three. Maybe I'm better then. Saunders and Melrose are talking now. About me. How hard it is to believe I am a scratch. They are right. This season is my very first season to ever be a healthy scratch. Ever. And it has happened here three times. At least three. Other times were questionable. The only ONLY good thing about not playing was to be watching Alex play. Alex, rakastettu, you looked wonderful out there and I am very proud of you. And even though I am upset, the party will still be tomorrow, at my house, and everyone is still invited. [OOC: Anyone who is interested in doing any comments or such about the party for Teemu's son can comment here or contact me at avsfinnishflash on AIM. I haven't decided on if I want to do a chat because I will be at a baseball game tomorrow afternoon, but you can comment here about gifts you brought or anything else.]

Just a few hours before the game now.  About to get ready.  Not sure how I feel being here.  Playing playoff games in this side of the arena.  In this locker room.  I really hate this though.  I am in San Jose when I should be home for Taavi's fourth birthday.  I know it is part of the job, to miss birthdays, but it does not make it any easier.  It is almost a given that I have a good chance to miss Eemil's birthday in February, and Eetu's birthday in Novemeber, but I would have hoped that Leevi's would have been an off day for playoff scheduling.  But no.  Stupid NHL.  *sighs*  Enough complaining.  

Happy Birthday to my youngest boy, Leevi.  And remember, party on Sunday for friends and teammates.  If you want to bring gifts, he loves anything hockey and legos.

I SCORED! Colorado was in desperate need of a victory after its longest winless streak in two years dropped the Avalanche just a point ahead of Vancouver in the Northwest Division. Selanne gave it to them, one-timing Paul Kariya's crossing pass through the crease for his first point since scoring his 15th goal Feb. 14 against Detroit. Selanne had a huge grin and was mobbed by teammates after securing Colorado's third win in 14 home games And I did it when team needed me too! Was not thinking about anything at time except scoring, but now that game is over, I say that this goal was for two very important people. Steve Moore, because we are all so very thankful that you will be ok and it was so great to have you at game. Teppo Numminen, because on same day, doctors declared his heart disease was not so terrible he could not play anymore. But now he is able to play and will be fine for five to ten years before they will do surgery to fix it.

DALLAS (AP) -- Dallas Stars defenseman Teppo Numminen has been diagnosed with a heart condition and is out indefinitely. Numminen has a dilated aorta, one of the large blood vessels leaving the heart, general manager Doug Armstrong said Saturday. Is not fair. Teppo is too sweet, too much of a good person for this to be happening to him. We have not been together for years, since I was sent to Anaheim and met Paul, but we were very close, still very good friends. He is so upset. And so am I. When next I get break, I should go to Dallas to visit him. Poor Teppo.

since I last posted.  I am just not too sure what to say.  I am still with Paul, of course.  I still miss Marty very much though.  He is happy in Anaheim though, I think.   I hope so.  I said if they were mean to him, I would find ways to make them hurt.  Paul will help too, right Paul?  Because you love me, yes?  

We were not doing so well in playing and we have done some strange trades.  Poor Brad going to Atlanta is not fair to him or Riku.  Poor fellow-Finn.   It will be ok, Riku, as long as there is love, there is a way to make relationships work, no matter how far apart you have to be.  Things worked with him in Hershey, yes?  And if you ever need to talk, I know I may not be very close to you, but I am here to talk with.

Last night was an interesting game.  Congratulations to Joe for his hat trick.  And to Alex.  Two goals, three assists.  You were all over last night and it was good to see you playing hard and well.  

That is all my update for now.
Stupid Avalanche management can fuck themselves. Too angry to say any more.  That is all for now.

Is just little over week until Valentines.  We play Detroit in afternoon, but night is still free.  So I wonder what plans to make.  Paul has not told me if he has plans for us, so I wonder on that.  But I also promise Marty we will do something too.  Decisions, decisions.  *kisses* to you know who and you know who.  If you do not know who, no kiss for you.  *pauses*  I think I have too much coffee this morning.

I think I made big mistake tonight.  I do not know what to say or do to figure out what is wrong.  I have much to talk over with Paul, I think.  And with Marty.  I only hope that things are still going to be ok.  Am not sure about game tomorrow.  I want to play, but we will have to see if I can.

I found new meme in Skoula's journal. This is very very strange. I am marrying wrong Av.
Which NHLer will you marry? by BradAusmus11
Full name:
You will marry:Joe Sakic
How many children?2
When will you divorce?July 8, 2014
Why will you divorce?he leaves you for a younger puckbunny
Created with quill18's MemeGen 2.0!
But if I add middle name, I get Star instead
Which NHLer will you marry? by BradAusmus11
Full name:
You will marry:Bill Guerin
How many children?5
When will you divorce?July 14, 2032
Why will you divorce?he leaves you for a younger puckbunny
Created with quill18's MemeGen 2.0!

Last night was stupid.  Penalties were stupid, refs were stupid, fans were stupid.  Was all stupid.  Ducks play bad now.  Not like when I was Duck with Paul.  All teams change so much.  Jets become Coyotes.  Ducks change.  Sharks change.  Now I change to be Av and Paul and I not find our old rhythm yet.  I miss it.  We are out of.. sink? No, um... sync.  Yes. 

Blake has very nice hard shot.  Is my fault for being in way, I think.  Don't know, but I am fine, just sore.  I forgot to say yesterday, but Happy Birthday to Danny.  Sorry you and Footer missed game.  Headaches are annoying things.  

Paul says he did not hear boos last night, but I know he did.  Boos hurt.  You spend so many years with one team and fans and then you leave, for some reason or other, and fans don't, what is word?  appreciate that you gave them so much of your life.  Is worse when you are traded away and lose all friends and then come back to play against old team and fans still boo you too.  Stupid fans.

After posting comment in Paul's journal, I decided I need new icons. But cannot decide what looks better. Ideas? Also did meme. Results not true, but oh well.
Naughty Fun by starsfreak
Username
What you didGroped
WithScott Stevens
WhereOn the ice
But you wanted it to beBrendan Shanahan
Created with quill18's MemeGen 2.0!

Well we tied Kings.  Alex got two points tonight.  Up to fifty-nine already.  Is good for him.  Rob got booed again.  We play Ducks tomorrow.  Fans will boo Paul.  I know it.  They booed last time.  Sharks boo me.  I think Californians like booing.  Is not fair to Paul.  We only leave California to play together and have shot at Cup.  At least, I leave California to play with Paul.  I will tell Paul to ignore Boos.  Fans just sore they not have him anymore.

There is pathetic man I know who have everything he want, and still feel there is something not right. He have best job, best home, best family, best friend, but still, is not enough. He is only happy for little time and then always unhappy again. I hate this man. I do not think he deserve any of these best things. I think he is empty man and always will be sad.

First I wake up Paul with breakfast and we eat in bed. Well, eventually we eat. ;) Then we spent early afternoon swimming hotel pool until we had to go to practice. It was very relaxing. :) And now we must leave for Arena and game, if Paul will stop messing with hair. He just wants to make sure he looks good for camera when he scores birthday hat trick. ;) Mina rakastan sinua, Paul.

I know it is very long time between update, but I have been very busy. Preseason is good, I love playing again, even if Colorado is not as nice as San Jose. I am close to buying house in good neighborhood. It is Paul neighborhood, so it must be good. ;) I feel comfortable now with team and we are playing well together. Paul and I are good too...everything is good. :)

That is really only opinion I have right now of Colorado. It is cold. Although I am told by teammates that it is not so cold, so maybe it is just shock from leaving Anaheim, which is very, very hot. At any rate, it cannot possibly get colder than Finland, so it will be okay.

It is very strange to be practicing with new team. I have done it many times, but it is not something to get used to. Paul makes it much easier, though. Even though we have not played on ice together in a long time it is just like I remember. It is nice to know that some things have not changed.

I love conditioning. Paul and JS and I all have worked out lot over past week. I think safe to say we are ready for camp. JS showed me a few stretches that have really helped me. I do not think I am ever being so flexible before.

Spending time in Anaheim makes me miss it so much more. There are many good memories. I wish sometimes we both could stay there. But it did not work this way. Opportunity was in Colorado, not here. Still, I will miss, and I know Paul will miss. And I know many will miss Paul.

Training camp begins in some weeks, and I convince Sirpa that I must return to America to get in shape. I do not tell her that Paul will have large part in getting me in shape for camp. ;) We do not want to be out of shape when we get to Colorado, yes? It will take much much work. Do you think you are up to task, Paul?

It is time to go home. Sirpa calls me from Helsinki and says boys miss me, family misses me, so yes I go home. I miss boys, and also Sirpa. She is very good woman and I love her in ways. Just not ways same as Paul.

I do not want to go at first and leave Paul, but then I think that I see Paul all next season, and is good, so okay I can go home and leave Paul for little time. Because I see in september. I love you, Paul. JS, take good care of him while I am gone, yes?
